      • addWeapon

        public int addWeapon(IWeapon piece)
        Request that a weapon be added to the game
        Parameters:
        piece - a IWeapon object to be added.
        Returns:
        If it was possible to add the weapon then Game.SUCCESS is returned If it was not possible (because the weapon would have been outside the playing area, or would have overlapped with another piece)then any value other than Game.SUCCESS may be returned,

      • addShield

        public int addShield(IShield piece)
        Request that a weapon be added to the game
        Parameters:
        piece - a IShield object to be aded
        Returns:
        If it was possible to add the shield then Game.SUCCESS is returned If it was not possible (because the weapon would have been outside the playing area, or would have overlapped with another piece) then any value other than Game.SUCCESS may be returned

      • getWeapon

        public IWeapon getWeapon(double x,
                double y)
        Get the weapon (if any) at a particular position
        Parameters:
        x - x value, in game coordinates.
        y - y value, in game coordinates
        Returns:
        If the specified x,y position lies within a weapon then a reference to that weapon is returned, otherwise the return value is null

      • getShield

        public IShield getShield(double x,
                double y)
        Get the shield (if any) at a particular position
        Parameters:
        x - x value, in game coordinates.
        y - y value, in game coordinates
        Returns:
        If the specified x,y position lies within a weapon then a reference to that weapon is returned, otherwise the return value is null

      • fireProjectile

        public java.util.List<IImpact> fireProjectile(IWeapon origin)
        Fire a projectile from a weapon
        Parameters:
        origin - The weapon that should fire the projectile
        Returns:
        A List of IImpact objects representing the trajectory of the projectile . The last object in this list represents the projectile's exit from the playing area. The other objects represent impacts with other pieces.

      • movePiece

        public int movePiece(IPiece piece,
            double x,
            double y)
        Request that a piece be moved
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece to be moved.
        x - x coordinate of position to which piece should be moved, in game coordinates
        y - x coordinate of position to which piece should be moved, in game coordinates
        Returns:
        If it was possible to move the piece to the specified position then Game.SUCCESS is returned If it was not possible (because the weapon would have been outside the playing area, or would have overlapped with another piece) then any value other than Game.SUCCESS may be returned
